story.text: (Updates to open)NEW YORK Jan 3 (Reuters) - U.S. stocks opened the first session of 2007 higher on Wednesday, with shares of Wal-Mart Stores Inc. (WMT.N) and Home Depot Inc. (HD.N) leading advances. Home Depot announced the resignation of its chairman and chief executive Robert Nardelli, reviving talk that the No. 1 U.S. home improvement chain could be a takeover target. Wal-Mart Stores Inc. (WMT.N) earlier forecast December same-store sales beat expectations. The Dow Jones industrial average .DJI was up 60.56 points, or 0.49 percent, at 12,523.71. The Standard & Poor's 500 Index .SPX was up 5.00 points, or 0.35 percent, at 1,423.30. The Nasdaq Composite Index .IXIC was up 19.88 points, or 0.82 percent, at 2,435.17.
story.title: us stocks - wall st . opens 2007 up , home depot rallies
